intro: Lepidium zionis, commonly known as the Zion cress, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the Zion National Park area. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and produces small, white or yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are small, dry pods containing several seeds. Lepidium zionis is adapted to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions, making it a unique and resilient species in its native habitat.
